32#include <sys/types.h>
33#include <sys/param.h>
34#include <sys/kcondvar.h>
35#include <sys/kernel.h>
36#include <sys/kmem.h>
37#include <sys/mutex.h>
38#include <sys/proc.h>
39#include <sys/threadpool.h>
40
41#include <sys/taskq.h>
42
43struct taskq_executor {
44 struct threadpool_job te_job; /* Threadpool job serving the queue. */
45 taskq_t *te_self; /* Backpointer to the queue. */
46 unsigned te_running:1; /* True if the job is running. */
47};
48
49struct taskq {
50 int tq_nthreads; /* # of threads serving queue. */
51 pri_t tq_pri; /* Scheduling priority. */
52 uint_t tq_flags; /* Saved flags from taskq_create. */
53 int tq_active; /* # of tasks (queued or running). */
54 int tq_running; /* # of jobs currently running. */
55 int tq_waiting; /* # of jobs currently idle. */
56 unsigned tq_destroyed:1; /* True if queue gets destroyed. */
57 kmutex_t tq_lock; /* Queue and job lock. */
58 kcondvar_t tq_cv; /* Queue condvar. */
59 struct taskq_executor *tq_executor; /* Array of jobs. */
60 struct threadpool *tq_threadpool; /* Pool backing the jobs. */
61 SIMPLEQ_HEAD(, taskq_ent) tq_list; /* Queue of tasks waiting. */
62};
63
64taskq_t *system_taskq; /* General purpose task queue. */
65
66static specificdata_key_t taskq_lwp_key; /* Null or taskq this thread runs. */
67
68/*
69 * Threadpool job to service tasks from task queue.
70 * Runs until the task queue gets destroyed or the queue is empty for 10 secs.
71 */
72static void
73task_executor(struct threadpool_job *job)
74{
75 struct taskq_executor *state = (struct taskq_executor *)job;
76 taskq_t *tq = state->te_self;
77 taskq_ent_t *tqe;
78 int error;
79
80 lwp_setspecific(taskq_lwp_key, tq);
81
82 mutex_enter(&tq->tq_lock);
83 while (!tq->tq_destroyed) {
84 if (SIMPLEQ_EMPTY(&tq->tq_list)) {
85 if (ISSET(tq->tq_flags, TASKQ_DYNAMIC))
86 break;
87 tq->tq_waiting++;
88 error = cv_timedwait(&tq->tq_cv, &tq->tq_lock,
89 mstohz(10000));
90 tq->tq_waiting--;
91 if (SIMPLEQ_EMPTY(&tq->tq_list)) {
92 if (error)
93 break;
94 continue;
95 }
96 }
97 tqe = SIMPLEQ_FIRST(&tq->tq_list);
98 KASSERT(tqe != NULL);
99 SIMPLEQ_REMOVE_HEAD(&tq->tq_list, tqent_list);
100 tqe->tqent_queued = 0;
101 mutex_exit(&tq->tq_lock);
102
103 (*tqe->tqent_func)(tqe->tqent_arg);
104
105 mutex_enter(&tq->tq_lock);
106 if (tqe->tqent_dynamic)
107 kmem_free(tqe, sizeof(*tqe));
108 tq->tq_active--;
109 }
110 state->te_running = 0;
111 tq->tq_running--;
112 threadpool_job_done(job);
113 mutex_exit(&tq->tq_lock);
114
115 lwp_setspecific(taskq_lwp_key, NULL);
116}
117
118void
119taskq_init(void)
120{
121
122 lwp_specific_key_create(&taskq_lwp_key, NULL);
123 system_taskq = taskq_create("system_taskq", ncpu * 4, PRI_KERNEL,
124 4, 512, TASKQ_DYNAMIC | TASKQ_PREPOPULATE);
125 KASSERT(system_taskq != NULL);
126}
127
128void
129taskq_fini(void)
130{
131
132 taskq_destroy(system_taskq);
133 lwp_specific_key_delete(taskq_lwp_key);
134}
135
136/*
137 * Dispatch a task entry creating executors as neeeded.
138 */
139static void
140taskq_dispatch_common(taskq_t *tq, taskq_ent_t *tqe, uint_t flags)
141{
142 int i;
143
144 KASSERT(mutex_owned(&tq->tq_lock));
145
146 if (ISSET(flags, TQ_FRONT))
147 SIMPLEQ_INSERT_HEAD(&tq->tq_list, tqe, tqent_list);
148 else
149 SIMPLEQ_INSERT_TAIL(&tq->tq_list, tqe, tqent_list);
150 tqe->tqent_queued = 1;
151 tq->tq_active++;
152 if (tq->tq_waiting) {
153 cv_signal(&tq->tq_cv);
154 mutex_exit(&tq->tq_lock);
155 return;
156 }
157 if (tq->tq_running < tq->tq_nthreads) {
158 for (i = 0; i < tq->tq_nthreads; i++) {
159 if (!tq->tq_executor[i].te_running) {
160 tq->tq_executor[i].te_running = 1;
161 tq->tq_running++;
162 threadpool_schedule_job(tq->tq_threadpool,
163 &tq->tq_executor[i].te_job);
164 break;
165 }
166 }
167 }
168 mutex_exit(&tq->tq_lock);
169}
170
171/*
172 * Allocate and dispatch a task entry.
173 */
174taskqid_t
175taskq_dispatch(taskq_t *tq, task_func_t func, void *arg, uint_t flags)
176{
177 taskq_ent_t *tqe;
178
179 KASSERT(!ISSET(flags, ~(TQ_SLEEP | TQ_NOSLEEP | TQ_NOQUEUE)));
180 KASSERT(ISSET(tq->tq_flags, TASKQ_DYNAMIC) ||
181 !ISSET(flags, TQ_NOQUEUE));
182
183 if (ISSET(flags, (TQ_SLEEP | TQ_NOSLEEP)) == TQ_NOSLEEP)
184 tqe = kmem_alloc(sizeof(*tqe), KM_NOSLEEP);
185 else
186 tqe = kmem_alloc(sizeof(*tqe), KM_SLEEP);
187 if (tqe == NULL)
188 return (taskqid_t) NULL;
189
190 mutex_enter(&tq->tq_lock);
191 if (ISSET(flags, TQ_NOQUEUE) && tq->tq_active == tq->tq_nthreads) {
192 mutex_exit(&tq->tq_lock);
193 kmem_free(tqe, sizeof(*tqe));
194 return (taskqid_t) NULL;
195 }
196 tqe->tqent_dynamic = 1;
197 tqe->tqent_queued = 0;
198 tqe->tqent_func = func;
199 tqe->tqent_arg = arg;
200 taskq_dispatch_common(tq, tqe, flags);
201
202 return (taskqid_t) tqe;
203}
204
205/*
206 * Dispatch a preallocated task entry.
207 * Assume caller zeroed it.
208 */
209void
210taskq_dispatch_ent(taskq_t *tq, task_func_t func, void *arg, uint_t flags,
211 taskq_ent_t *tqe)
212{
213
214 KASSERT(!ISSET(flags, ~(TQ_FRONT)));
215
216 tqe->tqent_func = func;
217 tqe->tqent_arg = arg;
218 mutex_enter(&tq->tq_lock);
219 taskq_dispatch_common(tq, tqe, flags);
220}
221
222/*
223 * Wait until all tasks have completed.
224 */
225void
226taskq_wait(taskq_t *tq)
227{
228
229 KASSERT(!taskq_member(tq, curlwp));
230
231 mutex_enter(&tq->tq_lock);
232 while (tq->tq_active)
233 kpause("qwait", false, 1, &tq->tq_lock);
234 mutex_exit(&tq->tq_lock);
235}
236
237/*
238 * True if the current thread is an executor for this queue.
239 */
240int
241taskq_member(taskq_t *tq, kthread_t *thread)
242{
243
244 KASSERT(thread == curlwp);
245
246 return (lwp_getspecific(taskq_lwp_key) == tq);
247}
248
249/*
250 * Create a task queue.
251 * Allocation hints are ignored.
252 */
253taskq_t *
254taskq_create(const char *name, int nthreads, pri_t pri, int minalloc,
255 int maxalloc, uint_t flags)
256{
257 int i;
258 struct threadpool *threadpool;
259 taskq_t *tq;
260
261 KASSERT(!ISSET(flags,
262 ~(TASKQ_DYNAMIC | TASKQ_PREPOPULATE | TASKQ_THREADS_CPU_PCT)));
263
264 if (threadpool_get(&threadpool, pri) != 0)
265 return NULL;
266
267 if (ISSET(flags, TASKQ_THREADS_CPU_PCT))
268 nthreads = MAX((ncpu * nthreads) / 100, 1);
269
270 tq = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(*tq), KM_SLEEP);
271 tq->tq_nthreads = nthreads;
272 tq->tq_pri = pri;
273 tq->tq_flags = flags;
274 mutex_init(&tq->tq_lock, NULL, MUTEX_DEFAULT, IPL_NONE);
275 cv_init(&tq->tq_cv, NULL, CV_DEFAULT, NULL);
276 SIMPLEQ_INIT(&tq->tq_list);
277 tq->tq_executor = kmem_alloc(sizeof(*tq->tq_executor) * nthreads,
278 KM_SLEEP);
279 for (i = 0; i < nthreads; i++) {
280 threadpool_job_init(&tq->tq_executor[i].te_job, task_executor,
281 &tq->tq_lock, "%s/%d", name, i);
282 tq->tq_executor[i].te_self = tq;
283 tq->tq_executor[i].te_running = 0;
284 }
285 tq->tq_threadpool = threadpool;
286
287 return tq;
288}
289
290taskq_t *
291taskq_create_proc(const char *name, int nthreads, pri_t pri, int minalloc,
292 int maxalloc, struct proc *proc, uint_t flags)
293{
294
295 return taskq_create(name, nthreads, pri, minalloc, maxalloc, flags);
296}
297
298/*
299 * Destroy a task queue.
300 */
301void
302taskq_destroy(taskq_t *tq)
303{
304 int i;
305 taskq_ent_t *tqe;
306
307 KASSERT(!taskq_member(tq, curlwp));
308
309 /* Wait for tasks to complete. */
310 taskq_wait(tq);
311
312 /* Mark destroyed and ask running executors to quit. */
313 mutex_enter(&tq->tq_lock);
314 tq->tq_destroyed = 1;
315 cv_broadcast(&tq->tq_cv);
316
317 /* Wait for all executors to quit. */
318 while (tq->tq_running > 0)
319 kpause("tqdestroy", false, 1, &tq->tq_lock);
320 mutex_exit(&tq->tq_lock);
321
322 for (i = 0; i < tq->tq_nthreads; i++)
323 threadpool_job_destroy(&tq->tq_executor[i].te_job);
324 threadpool_put(tq->tq_threadpool, tq->tq_pri);
325 mutex_destroy(&tq->tq_lock);
326 cv_destroy(&tq->tq_cv);
327 kmem_free(tq->tq_executor, sizeof(*tq->tq_executor) * tq->tq_nthreads);
328 kmem_free(tq, sizeof(*tq));
329}
